sections.title: Further reading

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: This section contains citations only and does not include gene abbreviations or names.
This section lists journal references and does not concern using gene abbreviations over full names.
There are no human gene names mentioned, as this section is focused on citations.
There are no orthologs of human genes in other species mentioned in this section.
There are no sentences where the usage of gene symbols is discussed; the section contains only citations.
There are no references to non-human genes or any gene narratives included in this section.
The section should maintain consistency in language usage, particularly in the citations.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: The references appear consistent in using American English formatting in journal titles and dates.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: Strong adherence overall, but slight inconsistencies in date formatting were noted.
requirement_evaluations.overlap_notes: No significant overlaps with other sections.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: The section only contains citations and does not involve any narrative that would be affected by the use of first-person language.
The section does not include scientific names or descriptions that require italics.

sections.meta_notes: This 'Further reading' section is primarily composed of structured citations and adherence to other requirements is not applicable. Consistent language usage was mostly observed.
